original_title: Out of the Ashes: Recovering the Lost Library of Herculaneum
overview: In 1752, an ancient library was discovered at Herculaneum, buried beneath the ashes of Mount Vesuvius. Astonishingly, nearly 2000 carbonized papyrus rolls were preserved, though some were so badly burned they looked like pieces of charcoal. While some texts from the philosophical library have been published, many of the papyri have yet to be unrolled or read.
title: Out of the Ashes: Recovering the Lost Library of Herculaneum
